topics.body:
I suppose I should elaborate on my laptop's problem, so any technically-minded forum-goers can give me a hand.

I've noticed fairly recently that my laptop burns through its memory ridiculously quickly. Example- I can completely max it out after watching only a couple videos on Youtube, after which it becomes impossible to open any sort of program. Force-closing more memory intensive programs provides only a temporary fix, and even if I restart, it swallows up one of the six GBs dedicated to memory right off the bat.

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54caf0a46368722bec5e0b00#post_54caf0a46368722bec5e0b00
You're gonna hate me for saying this, but I've only been using my laptop's built-in protection software. The college I go to has its own network protection software on top of that.

...But I just finished downloading Avast right now, and I'm about to find out what it uncovers. As ashamed as I am to say this, I've always been a bit leery of those online virus protection programs. The ones I find usually turn out ti be the very malware I was trying to protect myself from.

*ADDENDUM:* Avast just finished, but it didn't find anything. It's doubtful, but it could be some kind of hardware issue.
